citation.excerpt: Source of original paper results: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1609.04802v5.pdf
If you find a bug, create a GitHub issue, or even better, submit a pull request. Similarly, if you have questions, simply post them as GitHub issues.
Christian Ledig, Lucas Theis, Ferenc Huszar, Jose Caballero, Andrew Cunningham, Alejandro Acosta, Andrew Aitken, Alykhan Tejani, Johannes Totz, Zehan Wang, Wenzhe Shi

description.excerpt:
This repository contains an op-for-op PyTorch reimplementation 
of Photo-Realistic Single Image Super-Resolution Using a Generative Adversarial Network
Modify the contents of the file as follows.
Modify the contents of the file as follows.
In the following table, the psnr value in () indicates the result of the project, and - indicates no test.
I look forward to seeing what the community does with these models!

Despite the breakthroughs in accuracy and speed of single image super-resolution using faster and deeper convolutional neural networks, one central 
problem remains largely unsolved: how do we recover the finer texture details when we super-resolve at large upscaling factors? The behavior of 
optimization-based super-resolution methods is principally driven by the choice of the objective function. Recent work has largely focused on 
minimizing the mean squared reconstruction error. The resulting estimates have high peak signal-to-noise ratios, but they are often lacking 
high-frequency details and are perceptually unsatisfying in the sense that they fail to match the fidelity expected at the higher resolution. In this 
paper, we present SRGAN, a generative adversarial network (GAN) for image super-resolution (SR). To our knowledge, it is the first framework capable 
of inferring photo-realistic natural images for 4x upscaling factors. To achieve this, we propose a perceptual loss function which consists of an 
adversarial loss and a content loss. The adversarial loss pushes our solution to the natural image manifold using a discriminator network that is
perceptual similarity instead of similarity in pixel space. Our deep residual network is able to recover photo-realistic textures from heavily
The MOS scores obtained with SRGAN are closer to those of the original high-resolution images than to those obtained with any state-of-the-art method.
A simple and complete implementation of super-resolution paper.

excerpt.name: For the first time, mixed precision training has been added to the GAN task！

excerpt.body:
# SRGAN-PyTorch 1.0.0 Release Notes

- New Features
- Bug Fixes

## New Features

- Upload of pre-trained model weight file.
- The best result is automatically saved during training.
- Visualize training with the help of Tensorboard tools.

## Bug Fixes

- Fix PSNR and SSIM calculation error.
excerpt.name: This project was implemented according to most of the paper, and achieved similar results as the paper.

excerpt.body:
# SRGAN-PyTorch 1.0.0-beta Release Notes

- New Features
- Bug Fixes

## New Features

- The best result is automatically saved during training.
- Visualize training with the help of Tensorboard tools.

## Bug Fixes

- Fix PSNR and SSIM calculation error.
excerpt.name: This project was implemented according to most of the paper, and achieved similar results as the paper.

excerpt.body:
# SRGAN-PyTorch 0.4.0 Release Notes

- New Features
- Bug Fixes

## New Features

- Removed redundant functions and simplified code structure.
- Fully reproduce and exceed the original paper results.

## Bug Fixes

- Fix PSNR calculation error.
excerpt.name: This is a simple and easy to use version.
This is based on the pre-trained weights of DIV2K

excerpt.body:
# SRGAN-PyTorch 0.2.2 Release Notes

- New Features
- Bug Fixes

## New Features

**Add test model performance function**
We used the Thop tool to calculate the complexity of the entire model and the inference time. More details see [https://github.com/Lornatang/SRGAN-PyTorch#test-model-performance](https://github.com/Lornatang/SRGAN-PyTorch#test-model-performance)

**Using data to enhance post operation training**
After training, the effect is better than the original. 

## Bug Fixes

- Add support for tensorboard in the third library.
- Fix the parameter undefined error that may occur when using the custom data set loading method.
- Remove unused and obsolete kernelGAN methods.
excerpt.name: Some small improvements in model functions.

excerpt.body:
# SRGAN-PyTorch 0.2.1 Release Notes

- New Features
- Bug Fixes

## New Features

**Add AdaBelief optimizer**
A NeurIPS 2020 Spotlight, trains fast as Adam, generalizes well as SGD, and is stable to train GANs.[AdaBelief Optimizer: Adapting Stepsizes by the Belief in Observed Gradients
](http://xxx.itp.ac.cn/abs/2010.07468)

## Bug Fixes

- Fixed random seeds to ensure that the results can be reproduced every time.
- Single GPU is used in inference-oral, Not use multi GPUs.
excerpt.name: One time small update, but very useful.

excerpt.body:
# SRGAN-PyTorch 0.2.0 Release Notes

- New Features
- Bug Fixes

## New Features

**Add automatic mixed precision training**
It can save memory and speed up the training. Please refer to [https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/notes/amp_examples.html#amp-examples](https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/notes/amp_examples.html#amp-examples).

**Add support for distributed training**
Please refer to for more details [https://pytorch.org/tutorials/intermediate/ddp_tutorial.html](https://pytorch.org/tutorials/intermediate/ddp_tutorial.html).

**Automated data enhancement**
Please refer to for more details [https://github.com/kakaobrain/fast-autoaugment](https://github.com/kakaobrain/fast-autoaugment).

## Bug Fixes

- The definition of content loss is wrong. It should be `nn.L1Loss` instead of `nn.MSELoss`.
- Error in changing the definition of perceived loss.
- Fixed the problem of unable to read the video stream while inferring the video.
excerpt.name: For the most standard implementation of the model defined in the paper.
New weight of pre training model
